title: Army’s new $1.3bn ‘world leader’
text:
1100 Bendigo-built Hawkei protected vehicles for Aussie Army Ian McPhedran National defence writer News Corp Australia Network 1100 Bendigo-built Hawkei protected vehicles for Aussie Army Ian McPhedran National defence writer News Corp Australia Network Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull at a major Defence Procurement Announcement of the Hawkei military vehicle for the defence force. picture: David Crosling 
FRENCH defence giant Thales will build more than 1100 Australian-designed ‘baby Bushmaster’ protected mobility vehicles (PMVs) under a $1.3 billion contract announced today. 
The ‘Hawkei’ light PMV is a miniature version of the Bendigo built and battle tested Bushmaster armoured infantry vehicle that has saved dozens of lives in Afghanistan thanks to its hardened ‘V’ shaped hull and other unique blast proofing features. 
The vehicles provide high level protection from the insurgent weapon of choice, the Improvised Explosive Device (IED). The Hawkei protected mobility vehicle. Pic: Supplied 
Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull and Defence Minister Marise Payne travelled to the vehicle testing ground at Monegeetta north of Melbourne this morning to announce the huge deal that also includes 1000 trailers. 
Mr Turnbull said it was a great day for Australian advanced manufacturing and for 170 jobs in Bendigo. 
He said there was a very big export market potential for the vehicle. Other Stories
